intro: Erigeron speciosus superbus, commonly known as the showy fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its hairy stems and daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of white and purple. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as meadows and grasslands, often in dry or rocky soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are arranged in a composite head with both ray and disk florets. It is a perennial species that plays a role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining ecological balance in its native range.
